titleStmt.title: R. A. Price et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4637

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky.

We the undersigned Juror who tried W. N. Mayfield in the city court of Louisville at the February Term, for permitting gameing in his house, & assessed a fine of $200.00/00 do most earnestly recommend him to Executive Clemency

R A. Price (Forman
Patt Kelly --
Isaac Redman
J. M. Grove
D. Enochs
William Kiel
Rob H Ley
J. H. Edmonson
John Lowman
Jacob Friddle
Louis Chavalier
I. Phil Tomppert Jr. Clerk of the City Court of Louisville do hereby Certify that the above is the Jury that tried the case of the Comth vs. W. W. Mayfield

February 13th 1864
Attest
Phil Tomppert Jr. C. C. C. L
Direct to Clerk of Louisville City Court & oblige

Louisville City Ct
vs
W. N. Mayfield
Gaming
Remit $100
11th July/ 64
